job_description:
### **Summary**

Rokt is seeking a Highly Skilled Ecommerce Software Architect to join their team in Seattle, WA. The role involves designing, developing, and improving ecommerce technology that enhances customer experiences and empowers marketers.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for:
- Designing, developing, testing, deploying, and improving code that solves real-world problems.
- Owning complex product features end-to-end, focusing on customer impact.
- Operating with autonomy in solving problems.
- Collaborating with other teams to deliver new products.
- Creating fast, scalable, and easy-to-use applications.
- Building libraries and frameworks that others can use.
- Supporting and mentoring other engineers on best practices, architecture, and quality.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 6+ years of experience in software engineering.
- Strong commercial experience in languages like Go, Java, C#, or Python.
- Extensive experience with AWS, GCP, Azure, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
- An eagerness to work and learn openly, sharing knowledge with teammates.
- A willingness to communicate remotely using chat, docs, video calls, and online tools.

### **Benefits**

- Compensation: \$230k–\$285k per annum, including employee equity plan grants and world-class benefits.
- Accelerated career growth, with roadmaps to leadership and an annual training allowance of \$5000.
- Becoming a shareholder, with equity grants in the company.
- Catered lunch and healthy snacks in the office, plus gym membership and extra leave options.
- Generous retirement plans and fully funded premium health insurance for your entire family.
- Dog-friendly office space and flexible working arrangements.
- Access to the greatest talent in the industry and opportunities to see the world with offices in New York, Seattle, Sydney, Tokyo, and London.

### **Summary**

Riot Games is seeking a Senior Technical Lead - Game Foundations to join their team in Los Angeles, CA. The role involves leading the design and execution of technical solutions that drive business value for the VALORANT Foundations team.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Technical Lead, you will be responsible for collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver complex projects that empower developers. Your main tasks will include establishing systems, tools, and best practices for multi-platform game development, mentoring senior engineers, and being hands-on in development by writing high-quality code. You will also identify impactful technology investments and help teams navigate ambiguity by breaking down problems and communicating trade-offs.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 10+ years experience in professional software development, including shipping multiple games.
- 2+ years of experience as a technical lead.
- Have been responsible for driving the design and execution of organization-sized efforts (1-year+ scope).
- 5+ years professional experience with C++.
- Experience shipping an Unreal Engine game that targets PC and at least one of Console and Mobile.

### **Benefits**

- Medical, dental, and life insurance, parental leave for you, your spouse/domestic partner, and children, and a 401k with company match.
- Flexible work schedules and open paid time off policy.
- A culture that values teamwork, diversity, and inclusion.

### **Summary**

BAE Systems is seeking a Principal Software Engineer (Hybrid) to join their team in New York, NY. The role involves developing high-quality, real-time embedded software for fielded electronics platforms as part of a collaborative team focused on defense technologies.

### **About the Role**

As a Principal Software Engineer, you will work across multiple disciplines, collaborating with Systems, Hardware, and Test Engineers throughout all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle. The position requires more than 50% of work to be conducted onsite at a BAE Systems facility. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing software solutions, as well as supporting and maintaining existing software.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- Must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain a Secret clearance.
- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other scientific degree with strong software content.
- 4+ years of experience in software development.
- Ability to design, develop, and implement software solutions to meet project requirements, including coding, testing, debugging, and documentation.
- Understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices, with the ability to design and develop scalable and maintainable software solutions.
- Familiarity with the full software development lifecycle, from requirements analysis and design to implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
- Comfortable supporting and maintaining existing software, troubleshooting technical issues, and implementing bug fixes and enhancements as needed.
- Strong problem-solving skills that translate to working, maintainable software.
- Willingness to learn and develop new skills as needed.

**Preferred:**

- Experience in embedded software development.
- Working knowledge of software tools such as Jira, BitBucket, debuggers, etc.
- Experience with DO-178 or other defined software process.
- Experience with Agile Development and DevSecOps.
- Active Secret Clearance.

### **Benefits**

- Full-Time Salary Range: \$103k–\$176k.
- Health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance.
- Employee assistance program, legal plan, and discounts on home, auto, and pet insurance.
- Paid time off, paid holidays, and other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and applicable federal and state sick leave.
- Participation in the company recognition program for monetary or non-monetary awards.

### **Summary**

Mastercard is seeking a Gen AI Platform Lead Software Engineer to join their team in New York, NY. The role involves building a holistic platform for Generative AI Large Language Models (LLMs) and driving cloud usage and adoption across the company.

### **About the Role**

As a Gen AI Platform Lead Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, configuring, and implementing a Generative AI platform, including MLOps/LLMOps for both commercial and open-source LLMs. Your daily tasks will include ensuring alignment to cloud integration standards, identifying opportunities for efficiency, engaging with IT and business partners to create meaningful roadmaps, and championing Mastercard's engineering principles. You will also participate in the Software Engineering Guild, share knowledge, and drive meaningful metrics.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- Deep understanding of cloud providers including AWS and Azure, especially AI and GenAI-related cloud services (e.g., AWS SageMaker, AWS Bedrock, Azure ML).
- Experience with Generative AI LLM platform components such as model evaluation, governance, orchestration, and prompt libraries.
- Solid experience with site reliability engineering and creating resilient, supportable solutions.
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Proficient in web service design and implementation.
- Experienced with Python, Java, and other programming languages.

**Preferred:**

- Deep AI/ML experience with data science and analytics.
- Knowledge of AI-related data platforms (e.g., DataBricks, IBM watsonx).
- Experience with GenAI code assistants (e.g., GitHub Copilot, AWS Code Whisperer).
- Understanding of cloud security in regulated markets.
- Familiarity with different project management methodologies, including Agile/Scrum.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive compensation with eligibility for an annual bonus based on company performance.
- Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage.

### **Summary**

Shield AI is seeking an **Autonomous Behavior Development and Simulation Expert** to join their team in **Washington, DC**. The role involves developing and implementing autonomous behavior on Group 3 and Group 5 unmanned aircraft, directly impacting the development of the world's best AI pilot, Hivemind.

### **About the Role**

As a **Simulation Software Engineer** with the Hivemind Design Department, you will:
- Design and develop simulation environments that support the development and implementation of autonomous behavior.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with DoD and Industry standards.
- Drive technical design and integration of new simulated payloads for platform testing.
- Develop and maintain well-defined interfaces for government and business customers.

### **About You**

**Required:**
- Experience in a relevant DoD modeling and simulation environment.
- Strong C/C++ development experience and comfortability within UNIX/Linux environments.
- At least 10 years of industry experience.
- Experience working on projects with 10+ contributors.
- BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience.

**Preferred:**
*(No preferred qualifications listed in the job description.)*

### **Benefits**

- Competitive total compensation package, including salary, bonus, benefits, and equity.
- International benefits for employees working outside the U.S., including international premium, hardship differential, cost of living differential, living quarters allowance, foreign service transfer allowance, equity, international benefits, visa assistance, and relocation assistance.
- Estimated Salary: **\$202.3k** per year.

### **Summary**

Humana is seeking a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer to join their team in Concord, NH. The role involves developing scalable software solutions using a diverse range of technologies and programming languages, focusing on both user experience and functionality.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be responsible for all phases of the software development lifecycle, including front-end and back-end development, database integrations, and management of network, hosting, user interface, user experience, and server backend. You will collaborate with experienced developers, engage with Agile teams, and develop solutions using cloud-native stacks. Your role will also involve designing and implementing REST APIs, developing automated test scenarios, and upholding modern development standards.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.
- 5 or more years of experience designing, developing, and testing software applications and/or infrastructure.
- Passion for contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences.
- Experience with Cloud infrastructure (Azure, GCP).
- Experience with Vue.js, Node.js, .Net.
- Experience with DevOps.

**Preferred:**

- Experience with Adobe Product Suite (AEM, Experience Platform).
- Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD).
- Master's Degree.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive compensation range of \$106.9k–\$147k per year, with eligibility for a bonus incentive plan based on performance.
- Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, paid time off, short-term and long-term disability, and life insurance.

### **Summary**

Walmart is seeking a Software Engineer III (iOS) to join their team in Hicksville, NY. The role involves contributing to the development of mobile applications, enhancing functionality, and optimizing performance.

### **About the Role**

As a Software Engineer III (iOS), you will be responsible for implementing and enhancing features in iOS applications, collaborating with designers and product managers, participating in code reviews, debugging issues, and continuously learning new iOS technologies. You will work closely with both US and IDC teams to deliver a seamless iOS experience to pharmacy customers.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- Proficiency in Swift with a solid understanding of UIKit, Foundation, and basic iOS architecture.
- Experience with the full app lifecycle from development to release and updates in the App Store.
- Familiarity with version control systems like Git, and testing frameworks like XCTest.
- Basic understanding of design patterns such as MVC or MVVM.
- Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate within cross-functional teams.
- Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 2 years' experience in software engineering or related area.
- Option 2: 4 years' experience in software engineering or related area.

**Preferred:**

- Background in creating inclusive digital experiences, demonstrating knowledge in implementing Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 AA standards, assistive technologies, and integrating digital accessibility seamlessly.
- Knowledge of accessibility best practices.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive pay with performance-based bonus awards.
- 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, and multiple health plans.
- Health benefits include medical, vision, and dental coverage.
- Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase, and company-paid life insurance.
- Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting.
- Additional benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
- Annual salary range: \$108k–\$216k.

### **Summary**

Capital One is seeking a Senior Engineering Director - Full Stack to join their team in Wilmington, DE. The role involves leading a portfolio of diverse technology projects and a team of developers with deep experience in distributed microservices and full-stack systems.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Engineering Director - Full Stack, you will be responsible for leading a team of developers to create solutions that meet regulatory needs for the company. You will share your passion for technology trends, mentor other engineers, and collaborate with digital product managers to deliver robust cloud-based solutions that empower millions of Americans financially.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- Bachelor's Degree
- At least 4 years of experience in software engineering (Internship experience does not apply)
- At least 1 year experience with cloud computing (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud)

**Preferred:**

- Passion for staying on top of tech trends, experimenting with and learning new technologies, and participating in internal & external technology communities.

### **Benefits**

- (No benefits information provided in the job description.)

### **Summary**

Walmart is seeking a Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack Python, Gen AI Developer to join their team in Pacifica, CA. The role involves building highly scalable and reliable APIs, services, and applications for the next generation purchase order management system.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for leading a team, developing scalable applications, troubleshooting critical software issues, and implementing new architectural patterns. Your daily tasks will include integrating Generative AI models, building user-friendly interfaces with React, and serving as a communication layer between the frontend and backend systems. You will also provide support for existing systems and drive the development of action plans to resolve production issues.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 7+ years of experience building scalable applications.
- Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 3 years' experience in software engineering or related area, or 5 years' experience in software engineering or related area.
- Strong expertise in development of scalable cloud-native microservices.
- Strong expertise in designing and building APIs.
- Strong expertise with Cloud Technologies like Azure and GCP.
- Strong experience interfacing with Web Services platforms.
- Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment processes and tools such as Jenkins and Maven.

**Preferred:**

- Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Software Engineering, or related area and 1 year's experience in software engineering or related area.
- Background in creating inclusive digital experiences and knowledge in implementing Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 AA standards.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive pay with performance-based bonus awards.
- 401(k) match and stock purchase plan.
- Paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, and multiple health plans.
- Health benefits including medical, vision, and dental coverage.
- Additional benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, and education benefits covering tuition, books, and fees.
- The annual salary range for this position is \$117k–\$234k.

### **Summary**

MEMX is seeking a Senior Member of Staff, Client Software Engineering to join their team in Anywhere, United States. The role involves developing applications that support their core trading system and enhancing the user portal for their trading platform.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Member of Staff, Client Software Engineering, you will be responsible for:
- Developing applications that administer and support MEMX's core trading system.
- Working on the user portal to the trading platform, creating improvements and building products for internal and external users.
- Collaborating with Product Managers and stakeholders to understand market complexities and user needs.
- Ensuring solutions meet current and future user requirements to enhance product offerings.
- Designing best-in-class systems with a team of experienced developers.
- Developing and maintaining innovative products that deliver exceptional features and service.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 8 or more years of web development experience.
- Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a comparable discipline.
- Proficient in HTML5, ES6, CSS.
- Experienced in REST APIs, NodeJS, React, Angular, or an equivalent web framework, git.
- Strong professional and interpersonal skills including exceptional customer service, creative problem solving, and effective written and verbal communications.
- Broad systems thinking - ability to understand connections and relationships across functions and entities for both internal and external constituencies.
- Demonstrated ability to succeed as a self-starter in a dynamic environment.

**Preferred:**

- Experience with financial markets, distributed systems, and/or high-performance web applications.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive employee benefits and perks.
- Work From Home.
- Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision).
- Retirement Plan (401k).
- Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D).
- Unlimited Paid Time Off.
- Generous Paid Family Leave.
- Short Term & Long-Term Disability.
- Training & Development.
- Wellness Resources.
- Pay Range: \$155k–\$190k.

### **Summary**

State Farm is seeking a Software Engineer Java/Gosu to join their team in Tempe, AZ. The role involves providing production support for the PolicyCenter application and contributing to the modernization of the Personal Lines Auto Policy Administration System.

### **About the Role**

As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for working on the PLA Incident Management, Technical Triage, and Case Management team across P&C Auto/Fire - Personal Lines Auto teams. Your daily tasks will include supporting the PL-Auto application, collaborating with over 50 product teams, and addressing complex production problems.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 4+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent.
- 4+ years of Object JAVA Oriented development experience.
- 2+ years of Gosu development experience.
- 2+ years of experience with CI/CD Pipelines and SDLC best practices.
- Ability to triage complex production problems and Incident Management.
- Strong aptitude and demonstrated ability to learn new languages and frameworks.
- Knowledge of agile methodologies.
- Strong communication skills, both verbal & written.
- Eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization.

**Preferred:**

- Guidewire PolicyCenter experience is highly preferable.
- Enthusiasm for innovation and new ideas.
- Ability to collaborate and build relationships locally & across locations.
- Flexibility to provide production support on weekends and off-hours as needed.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on individual and enterprise performance.
- Compensation Range: \$85.5k–\$241.25k.
- Potential yearly incentive pay: up to 18% of base salary.
- 401k Plan.
- Health Insurance.
- Dental/Vision plans.
- Life Insurance.
- Paid Time Off.
- Annual Merit Increases.
- Tuition Reimbursement.
- Health Initiatives.

### **Summary**

EMTAK LLC is seeking a Geospatial Data Analyst and Engineer to join their team in Annapolis, MD. The role involves developing cutting-edge geospatial analysis, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), and visualization microservices to support mission-focused systems.

### **About the Role**

As a Geospatial Data Analyst and Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable and performant Java-based microservices that interact with both relational and NoSQL databases. Your daily tasks will include collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, developing Java microservices focused on geospatial data processing, and integrating geospatial functionality into services.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- TS/SCI with Polygraph.
- Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
- Understanding of the Java programming language.
- Understanding of microservices architecture and design principles.
- Familiarity with relational and NoSQL databases and their interactions.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
- Effective communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
- Self-motivated and able to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.

**Preferred:**

- Experience with geospatial libraries and tools (e.g., GDAL, GeoTools).
- Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS.
- Exposure to containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
- Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).

### **Benefits**

- No benefits information provided.

### **Summary**

Uber is seeking a Senior Software Engineer - Backend to join their team in Seattle, WA. The role involves driving the development and operations of security services and frameworks to support user-facing products and platforms across Uber.

### **About the Role**

As a Senior Software Engineer - Backend, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing software solutions to enhance the security posture of the organization. Your daily tasks will include building backend infrastructure for ETL, conducting code reviews and testing, and collaborating with cross-functional teams such as network operations, incident response, and compliance to ensure a cohesive approach to cybersecurity.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- BS/MS Degree in Computer Science or related field.
- 5+ years of industry experience in a software development environment.
- Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Golang, or Python.
- Hands-on experience with middleware, message queues, caches, and other related technologies.
- Strong experience in architecture design, high-availability, and high-performance systems.
- Deep understanding of distributed systems.

**Preferred:**

- Prior experience leading the design and development of complex systems, preferably in big data or related fields.
- Experience with building real-time data pipelines.
- Deep understanding of distributed systems, such as load balancing, distributed transactions, CAP/BASE, etc.
- Experience with infrastructure security enhancement, threat detection, and mitigation.

### **Benefits**

- Base salary range for this role is \$185k–\$205.5k per year.
- Eligibility to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of compensation.
- Various benefits including health insurance.

### **Summary**

MAG USA Inc. is seeking a Next Generation Threat System Software Engineer to join their team in Lexington Park, MD. The role involves designing and developing software solutions for next-generation threat systems and collaborating with experts in the field.

### **About the Role**

As a Next Generation Threat System Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and developing software solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams for seamless integration, and testing and debugging software to ensure high-quality results.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 4+ years of experience in software engineering, preferably with EW systems.
- Strong understanding of programming languages such as C++, Python, and Lua.
- Experience with database programming and scripting.
- Excellent communication skills.

**Preferred:**

- Experience with EW systems.

### **Benefits**

- The estimated salary range for this position is \$140,000 to \$180,000 per year, depending on location and qualifications.
- Benefits and compensation packages will be discussed during the interview process.

### **Summary**

Coinbase is seeking a Staff Software Engineer, Fullstack (Developer - Onchain Payments) to join their team remotely in the United States. The role involves leading the development of a new onchain payments product that aims to disrupt the payments industry using crypto technology.

### **About the Role**

As a Staff Software Engineer, you will be responsible for bringing a 0-to-1 product to life to replace the global payment stack with crypto rails. Your daily tasks will include leading the fullstack design and development of a secure, high-performance product using TypeScript, Go, and Solidity, rapidly prototyping user flows, integrating with existing Coinbase surfaces, and driving the adoption of a novel open-source web3 payment protocol. You will also optimize performance, troubleshoot complex issues, and provide technical guidance to the engineering team.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 8+ years of experience in software development with a strong focus on fullstack development; 2+ years of experience in a leadership position of a crypto start-up is a plus.
- Mastery of Go, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Solidity; familiarity with Ruby is a plus.
- Proven track record of rapidly shipping high-quality fullstack systems.
- Deep understanding of Ethereum and EVM-compatible chains and experience with developing smart contracts.
- Strong expertise in frontend development using modern frameworks like React, Next.js, and Angular.
- Solid understanding of distributed systems, microservices architecture, and event-driven architectures, including experience with databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB), caching systems (Redis, Memcached), and message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
- Experience with developer operations, including Cloud providers such as AWS and containerization technologies such as Kubernetes.
- Deep understanding of web security best practices and experience with implementing secure coding practices for financial systems.
- Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to find elegant solutions to complex challenges in the crypto payment processing domain.
- Outstanding communication, leadership, and collaboration skills, with the ability to inspire and mentor teams.
- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
- Crypto-forward experience, including familiarity with onchain activity such as interacting with Ethereum addresses, using ENS, and engaging with dApps or blockchain-based services.

**Preferred:**

- Experience in a leadership position within a crypto start-up.
- Familiarity with Ruby.

### **Benefits**

- Pay Transparency Notice: Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below.
- Full-time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k)).
- \$211.65k–\$249k.

### **Summary**

Agoda is seeking a Staff Software Engineer – Front End to join their team in Portland, OR. The role involves building, designing, and optimizing user interfaces for their online travel booking platform.

### **About the Role**

As a Staff Software Engineer (Front End) at Agoda, you will be responsible for engaging users with visually appealing and highly functional web applications. Your daily tasks will include collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless application functionality, driving best practices for performance, and mentoring junior team members.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- At least 8 years of experience in front-end development, particularly with client-side frameworks (React preferred).
- Strong core front-end skill set in JavaScript and the TypeScript ecosystem.
- Strong architecture skills and ability to drive decision-making in the team.
- Experience working with component libraries.
- Strong product sense and a passion for client-side performance optimization.
- Demonstrated ability to drive changes and impact across various teams.
- Love for collaboration through code reviews and architecture discussions.

**Preferred:**

- Experience leading teams and projects to solve significant, complex problems.
- Experience working in a large-scale app or internet company.
- Experience in a data-driven company, including analyzing and working with big data.
- Familiarity with modern JavaScript/TypeScript libraries and tooling (e.g., VueJS, AngularJS).
- Proficiency in modern coding and design practices, such as Clean Code, SOLID principles, and TDD.

### **Benefits**

Not provided.

### **Summary**

GSK is seeking an AI/ML Services - Software Engineer to join their team in South San Francisco, CA. The role involves developing cutting-edge products in Machine Learning and AI to transform medicine and improve patient outcomes.

### **About the Role**

As an AI/ML Services - Software Engineer, you will be responsible for building a first-in-class platform that includes tools and services for high-performance computing, model training and deployment, and metrics calculation. Your work will aim to decrease AI/ML cycle times and enhance the quality of shipped services by simplifying platform integration and accelerating R&D processes.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- Bachelor’s or graduate degree in Computer Science, preferably focused on software engineering, high-performance computing, or machine learning.
- 2+ years of industry experience in software design or architecture.
- Experience in Python and in deploying APIs/backend services.
- Experience developing services and infrastructure on GCP or similar cloud software development.
- Experience working with Docker and Kubernetes, or closely related containerization and cluster computing frameworks.
- Strong sense of the abstractions needed to represent ML products and workflows, with demonstrated experience in database design, operations, and microservice development.

**Preferred:**

- Experience in event-based orchestration for multi-tenant use.
- Collaboration and a customer-first mindset, with experience partnering with Platform and Infra teams and machine learning product teams.
- Experience in DevOps and machine learning orchestration (using TensorFlow, Pytorch, or similar).
- Experience with Search and Ranking, Knowledge Graphs, Feature Stores, or other AI/ML products.
- Experience upholding software/production best practices in a larger organization.
- Agile-minded with proficiency in iterative software development and prototyping.

### **Benefits**

- The annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges from \$123.75k to \$206.25k, depending on various factors including work location, skills, experience, and education level.
- This position offers an annual bonus and eligibility to participate in a share-based long-term incentive program.
- Available benefits include health care and other insurance benefits (for employee and family), retirement benefits, paid holidays, vacation, and paid caregiver/parental and medical leave.

### **Summary**

Recruiting from Scratch is seeking a Robotics Software Engineer to join their team in New York, NY. The role involves architecting and owning a greenfield web application that will revolutionize how developers interact with robotics hardware.

### **About the Role**

As a Robotics Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and building an intuitive interface for complex robotics development workflows. You will collaborate with an AI-first approach to create developer tools that understand systems programming and shape the technical direction of a product used by next-generation robotics companies. You will work directly with founding team members in a fast-paced, ownership-driven environment.

### **About You**

**Required:**

- 3+ years of frontend engineering experience, particularly with developer-facing tools.
- Strong foundation in TypeScript, JavaScript, React, and Node.js.
- Experience with IDE extensions, developer tools, or systems programming interfaces.
- Track record of building intuitive UIs for complex technical workflows.

### **Benefits**

- Competitive compensation: \$120k–\$180k base + equity.
- Comprehensive healthcare coverage.
- Unlimited PTO with flexible WFH policy.
- Daily team lunches in a modern office.
- A ground-floor opportunity at a VC-backed startup with runway.

### **Summary**

Quantum Information Systems Solutions is seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer to join their team in Michigan. The role involves designing and developing applications from the front-end user interface to the back-end services and database design, ensuring a seamless and high-performing user experience.

### **About the Role**

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantum, you will:
- Collaborate with design and development teams to architect and develop solutions based on design guidelines and requirements.
- Assist in the design/concept phase by preparing prototypes and related documentation.
- Execute the development of easy-to-use, high-performance applications.
- Ensure solutions are architected for flexibility, performance, and security.
- Implement front-end solutions that are consistent and compatible across multiple platforms, browsers, devices, and resolutions.
- Maintain well-commented code and ensure consistency across projects through code standards and documentation.
- Coordinate with QA team members to ensure developed solutions are easily testable.
- Maintain updated project documentation and task status using online collaboration tools.

### **About You**

**Required:**
- Legal authorization to work within the United States.
- Experience developing web-based applications and services using ASP.NET with experience in both C# and VB.
- Mastery of front-end web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent background/experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Web/Mobile Application Development, or related fields.
- Experience with databases including Microsoft SQL, Oracle, and MySQL.
- Meticulous attention to detail and user experience.
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Ability to travel globally per client and project requirements.

**Preferred:**
- Previous experience developing enterprise-grade applications, web APIs, and services.
- Knowledge of front-end frameworks and technologies such as AngularJS, Bootstrap, jQuery, LESS, and Sass.
- Experience with front-end libraries like Kendo UI or DevCraft.
- Strong understanding of responsive design and optimizing media queries for various devices and resolutions.
- Mobile development experience with iOS and Android.
- Exposure to server-side frameworks such as Node.js and languages like Java, C++, Objective C, Swift, or Python.
- Experience working with Functional Requirements, Design Documents, Style Guides, and Design Mockups.
